holes.desc: Opening par 5 playing gently down the hill, where a solid drive sets up a chance to advance near the green and start the round with a good look at birdie.
A straightforward par 4 with room off the tee; favor the middle of the fairway to leave a comfortable mid-iron into a receptive green.
A mid-length par 4 where placement matters more than distance; avoid getting out of position and you’ll have a simple approach into a fairly flat putting surface.
The first par 3, modest in length but fully exposed to the breeze; commit to your yardage and aim for the center of the green.
A strong par 5 that rewards two solid shots; long hitters can challenge in two while others lay up to their favorite wedge distance.
A classic valley par 4 with a slightly narrower driving corridor; find the short grass and you’ll be rewarded with a straightforward approach.
A short par 3 that offers a great birdie opportunity if you control your distance; missing long brings a tougher chip back up the slope.
A scoring par 4 where a good tee shot leaves only a short iron or wedge; stay patient and aim for the fat side of the green when pins are tucked.
A solid finishing par 4 for the outward nine, slightly uphill into the green; take enough club on your approach and trust your line.
The back nine opens with a straightforward par 4; favor the right half of the fairway for the best angle into the green.
Another par 4 that rewards a confident drive; subtle slopes around the green can funnel approaches, so land it on the correct tier.
A mid-length par 3 where club selection is everything; swirling winds off the valley can make it play longer or shorter than the number.
A par 5 that tempts you to attack but punishes wayward shots; smart players pick a target, find the fairway, and choose their layup or go-for-it line carefully.
A medium par 4 framed by hillsides; positioning your tee ball is key to avoiding awkward lies into this sloping green.
A shorter par 3 where accuracy is more important than power; aim for the middle and take your two-putt par when the pin is on the edges.
One of the tougher par 5s coming home, with length and elevation changes; play it as a true three-shot hole unless everything is working.
A demanding par 4 late in the round, where a precise drive sets up a mid-to-long approach; par here always feels like a win.
A memorable closing par 4 back toward the clubhouse; commit to your target off the tee, then enjoy one last full swing into a green framed by mountain views.
